title: Integrated metabolomics and transcriptomics unravel the biosynthZaesis mechanism of anthocyanin in postharvest red raspberry (Rubus idaeusL.).
abstract: Anthocyanins are crucial secondary metabolites that are responsible for pigment deposition in fruits. Raspberry fruit color shifts from white to red during natural or postharvest ripening. However, the precise mechanisms and biosynthetic pathways of anthocyanins in postharvest raspberries remain unclear.
